name: Caspian Sea
hint: World's largest enclosed inland body of water, bordered by five countries

name: Lake Baikal
hint: Deepest and oldest freshwater lake in the world, located in Siberia

name: Aral Sea
hint: Once the fourth-largest lake, now largely dried up in Central Asia

name: Dead Sea
hint: Hypersaline lake at the lowest point on Earth's surface

name: Tonle Sap
hint: Largest freshwater lake in Southeast Asia, in Cambodia

name: Lake Balkhash
hint: One of Asia's largest lakes, half fresh and half salt water, in Kazakhstan

name: Lake Urmia
hint: Shrinking salt lake in northwestern Iran, once the largest lake in the Middle East

name: Lake Toba
hint: Massive volcanic crater lake in Sumatra, Indonesia

name: Dal Lake
hint: Famous houseboat lake in Srinagar, Kashmir

name: Pangong Lake
hint: High-altitude endorheic lake spanning India and China in the Himalayas

name: Lake Issyk-Kul
hint: Second-largest alpine lake in the world, in the mountains of Kyrgyzstan

name: Lake Biwa
hint: Largest freshwater lake in Japan, near the ancient capital of Kyoto

name: Lake Van
hint: Largest lake in Turkey, a soda lake in the eastern Anatolian highlands

name: Lake Inle
hint: Famous lake in Myanmar known for its leg-rowing fishermen and floating gardens

name: Qinghai Lake
hint: Largest lake in China, a saltwater lake on the Tibetan Plateau

name: Lake Songkhla
hint: Largest natural lake in Thailand, a lagoon in the southern peninsula

name: Sea of Galilee
hint: Freshwater lake in Israel of immense biblical significance, fed by the Jordan River

name: Poyang Lake
hint: Largest freshwater lake in China, in Jiangxi province along the Yangtze

name: Lake Khanka
hint: Largest lake in the Russian Far East, shared with China at the Manchurian border

name: Chilika Lake
hint: Largest coastal lagoon in India, a Ramsar wetland in Odisha famous for birdwatching
